pr_title: DB-10889 avoid flattening subqueries with value-producing aggregates

timeline.message: DB-10889 avoid flattening subqueries with count(*).
DB-10889 extend exclusion to all value-producing aggregates.

timeline.bodyText: Can you add here a short explanation or an example of what we want to avoid?
timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText: can you add some tests that check the flattening is still happening for the valid cases? Or is that already covered by some other ITs?
timeline.author: dgomezferro

replies.bodyText: I added some tests for non-value-producing aggregates.
replies.author: hatyo

timeline.bodyText:
I would have a loop checking all resultColumns instead of just check the first one.
Yes, we don't support tuple comparison (e.g., (0, 1) = (select sum(a), avg(a) from ...)) yet. But given that we already moved one step further to support (a, b,) in (select x, y from ...), tuple comparison is not far anymore. It doesn't hurt to anticipate that.
